thread.title: Unioto ends superb season at OHSAA state golf tourney
thread.title_full: Unioto ends superb season at OHSAA state golf tourney

title: Unioto ends superb season at OHSAA state golf tourney
text:
Unioto ends superb season at OHSAA state golf tourney Derrick Webb , Reporter 3:15 a.m. EDT October 18, 2015 Unioto's Peyton Cooper hits a tee shot during the second round of the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. (Photo: Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio) 19 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
SUNBURY - Saturday’s end result and overall finish may have not been to their liking, but there’s no getting around the fact that Unioto’s boys golf team had a spectacular season. Buy Photo John Glenn's Nathaniel Bennett tees off during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo Coshocton's Gage Bosson watches his tee shot on the 18th hole during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo Shelby's Brock Kehres watches his approach shot on the ninth hole during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo Shelby's Brock Kehres tees off on the ninth hole during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Shelby's Brock Kehres figures statistics during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Bryan Smith putts on the eighth hole during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio John Glenn's Dylan Van Fossen chips during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Nathaniel Bennett putts on the fourth hole during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Bryan Smith hits a tee shot during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Bryan Smith putts on the fourth hole during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Bryan Smith chips onto the third green during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Bryan Smith hits his approach shot on the third hole during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Colin Harshbarger putts on the fourth hole during the Division II state tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Colin Harshbarger chips onto the fourth green during the Division II state golf tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Fullscreen Buy Photo John Glenn's Colin Harshbarger and Lima Shawnee's Jacob Good walk to the fourth green during the Division II state golf tournament at North Star Resort. Sam Blackburn/Gannett Ohio Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide 
The Shermans ended their 2015 campaign Saturday afternoon at NorthStar Golf Course as one of 12 teams to participate in the Division II OHSAA State Golf Tournament. 
In total, Unioto carded a 356 on day two of the tournament, resulting in a two-day total of 701 — good enough for 10th place overall after fighting frost, wind and temperatures of below 40 degrees. 
“Our kids played very well this season," Unioto coach Dan Drummond said. "We probably, truthfully, surpassed what I thought we would accomplish. I know they're disappointed and they wanted to shoot better today, but we had a great year. I've had great senior leadership, and our kids all get along. That makes it so much easier when you coach. We've just had a rough two days here, but who didn't? The weather wasn't anybody's friend." 
Scioto Valley Conference Player of the Year Peyton Cooper led the way on day two by shooting an 85. He was followed by teammates Jacob Calvin (88), Scott Freeman (89), Cole Karr (94) and Bane Adkins (96). 
Coopers’ two-day total of 166 also led the team, while Freeman carded a 172, Calvin shot a 182, Adkins managed a 184 and Karr finished with a 187. 
Those scores put the finishing touches on a season in which the Tanks won their seventh straight SVC title as well as sectional and district crowns. 
“This whole season has been great for our whole team," Cooper said. "Coming out and winning sectionals and districts, qualifying for state and coming up here and getting this experience has been pretty awesome." 
Cooper, individually, had a great year as well. The senior won individual conference, sectional and district titles while leading the Shermans with a nine hole average of 36.3. 
"I've had a great season," Cooper said. "Coming (to Sunbury), I kind of wanted to make all-Ohio, but in the end, it's always good just to be here. And to win titles like I have throughout the year, it's just awesome to finally see your hard work pay off." 
Cooper, along with seniors Adkins and Freeman, will end their high school golf careers having won four consecutive conference and sectional titles. 
"I couldn't ask for anything more," Adkins said. "We've had a pretty dominant run and have represented 'The U' very well. Unioto golf is just something amazing. We've been able to take it so far so many times, and I'm very proud of our team. One thing we've had this year is leadership. That's taken us a long way." 
Next year, leadership will be sought after in Cole Karr, who will return to the team as a senior. 
"I tried my best today," Karr said. "I'm not really happy with what I shot, but this is a tough course. But I'll have the same goal next year, to get to the state tournament. I'm going to work harder, and I think we have a good chance to make it back here. This year, we just went out with a bang, and I want that to happen in my senior year as well." 19 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1ROWSRb TOP VIDEOS
